arts.ttl: Conference League | APOEL 2-1 Fiorentina: Match Report
arts.sum: Fiorentina’s impressive winning streak came to an unexpected halt in Nicosia, where they suffered a surprising 2-1 defeat to APOEL in the Conference League. The Viola, who had won their last seven competitive matches, including two in the Conference League, faced challenges that ultimately cost them the game. Returning from suspension, Lucas Martinez Quarta was back in the lineup, while Albert Gudmundsson and Danilo Cataldi were sidelined due to injuries. APOEL, who had recently dropped down from both the Champions League and Europa League, were looking to turn their fortunes around after a disappointing start in the group stage. Conference League | APOEL v Fiorentina: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: Fiorentina manager Raffaele Palladino is expected to make several changes to his lineup for their upcoming midweek match against APOEL, with an eye on Sunday’s crucial Serie A encounter with Hellas Verona. In attack, top scorer Moise Kean is likely to be rested, with Christian Kouame set to lead the line. This rotation comes as Kean’s usual strike partner, Albert Gudmundsson, remains sidelined due to injury. A significant change is expected between the posts, as cup goalkeeper Pietro Terracciano is poised to replace David de Gea. arts.ttl: Who is finished? David de Gea sends Onana and Man Utd a message
arts.sum: Last week he put on a man of the match performance with some huge saves in the 1-0 win over Genoa, before keeping another clean sheet on Sunday in the 1-0 victory at Genoa. In arguably the comeback story of the year, discarded former Man Utd star David de Gea has shown that he is far from finished.
